errors.error_description: The command `pip install piccolo[postgres]` may fail in some shells (like zsh) because it lacks quotes. The shell might interpret `[postgres]` as a glob pattern instead of part of the package name.
The command `piccolo asgi new --orm piccolo` is incorrect. The `--orm` flag is not a valid parameter for this command.

The installation instructions show the `pip install` command being run before the command to activate the virtual environment. This will install the package in the global or user site-packages instead of the intended virtual environment.
correction_candidates: Move the `pip install` commands to the top, before creating the virtual environment.
Replace `source myenv/bin/activate` with `myenv/bin/pip install 'piccolo[postgres]'` and remove the separate pip install step.
Move the `source myenv/bin/activate` command to be right after `python3 -m venv myenv` and before any `pip install` commands.
Remove the virtual environment creation steps entirely.
errors.golden_answer: Move the `source myenv/bin/activate` command to be right after `python3 -m venv myenv` and before any `pip install` commands.
